href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/germany-for-tourists/castles-and-palaces/burghausen-castle/\">Burghausen</a>, Germany. – <em>Hyde Flippo</em></small></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>For Expats by Expats</strong><br>\n<strong><a title=\"Expat Blog\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/for-expats/expat-blog/\">THE GERMAN WAY EXPAT BLOG</a></strong><br>\nFor border=\"0\"></a></p>\n<p><strong>Living in Austria, Germany and Switzerland</strong><br>\nIt is only when you leave your own country to travel or live in a different one that you fully appreciate how much we humans are not only creatures of habit, but also of culture. Travelers and expatriates in Germany, Austria, Switzerland or other countries often feel a loss of things they once took for granted. The most significant of these are language and daily culture.</p>\n<p>See our resources for <strong><a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/\">TRAVELERS</a></strong>&nbsp;and EXPATS below!</p>\n<hr>\n<p><span style=\"color: #cc3300;\"><strong><em>FEATURED TOPICS</em></strong></span><br>\n<strong>Life, Culture and Customs</strong> in German-Speaking Europe:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong><a title=\"Moving to Germany\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/for-expats/living-in-germany/getting-a-residence-permit-for-germany/how-to-immigrate-to-germany/\">How to Immigrate to Germany</a></strong> – With residence permit categories, advice, and guidelines</li>\n<li><strong><a title=\"Expat 'How To' Guides\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/for-expats/living-in-germany/expat-how-to-guides-for-germany/how-to-eat-like-a-german/\">How to Eat Like a German</a></strong> – A new German Way Expat How-To Guide</li>\n<li><strong><a title=\"For car buffs\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/auto-factory-and-museum-tours-in-germany-for-car-buffs-and-car-buyers/\">Auto Factory and Museum Tours in Germany for Car Buffs and Car Buyers</a></strong> – Seven German automakers offer factory tours. Most also have fascinating car museums to visit.</li>\n<li><strong><a title=\"More...\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/history-and-culture/\">History and Culture</a></strong> – More related to German-speaking Europe</li>\n</ul>\n<hr>\n<div id=\"attachment_12173\" style=\"width: 1010px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/berliner-volksbank_1000.jpg\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-12173\" src=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/berliner-volksbank_1000.jpg\" alt=\"Berliner Volksbank\" width=\"1000\" height=\"573\" srcset=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/berliner-volksbank_1000.jpg 1000w, https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/berliner-volksbank_1000-300x172.jpg 300w, https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/berliner-volksbank_1000-768x440.jpg 768w, https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/berliner-volksbank_1000-500x287.jpg 500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px\"></a><p class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>One of the first things expats in Germany need to do is open a bank account. Learn how that’s done in <a title=\"Expat 'How To' Guides\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/for-expats/living-in-germany/expat-how-to-guides-for-germany/how-to-open-a-bank-account-in-germany/\">How To Open a Bank Account in Germany</a></strong>. PHOTO: Erin Porter</p></div>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.goldenfrog.com/vyprvpn/special/vpn-seasonal-special?offer_id=174&amp;aff_id=1690\" target=\"_blank\"><img class=\"alignright size-full wp-image-11473\" src=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_vpn005.png\" alt=\"vyprVPN\" width=\"200\" height=\"200\" srcset=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_vpn005.png 200w, https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_vpn005-150x150.png 150w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px\"></a></p>\n<p><strong>Expat “How To” Guides for Germany</strong></p>\n<p>If you’re new to Germany (or maybe even if you’re not), you’ll find our step-by-step expat “How To” guides very helpful. The <a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/for-expats/living-in-germany/expat-how-to-guides-for-germany/\">“How To” guides</a> cover many topics related to living and working in Germany. Sample topics include: Getting a residence permit, using your cell phone in Europe, German grocery shopping, taking pets to Germany, moving to Germany, and even having a baby in Germany! <strong><a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/for-expats/living-in-germany/expat-how-to-guides-for-germany/\">More…</a></strong></p>\n<table style=\"border: 1px solid #cccccc; width: 100%; padding: 12px;\">\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">Can you use your US iPhone in Germany? It depends. See <strong><a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/telephone-tips-for-germany/cell-phones-in-europe/iphone-in-germany/\">The iPhone in Germany and Europe</a></strong> for more about traveling with your iPhone, how to unlock your iPhone, or how to buy a new iPhone.</td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n<div id=\"attachment_3120\" style=\"width: 252px\" class=\"wp-caption alignright\"><a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/banks-money/international-money-transfers/international-money-transfers-2/\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-3120\" title=\"Click to learn more!\" src=\"https://www.german-way.com/imagesGW/Geldautomat_242v.jpg\" alt=\"International money transfers\" width=\"242\" height=\"375\"></a><p class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>An ATM in Germany.</strong><br>Photo © Hyde Flippo</p></div>\n<p><strong>International Money Transfers</strong><br>\nThe best way to <a title=\"International money transfers\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/banks-money/international-money-transfers/international-money-transfers-2/\">transfer funds</a> either to or from Germany (or Europe) depends on several factors, only one of which is cost. The method you use will depend on the amount, type and timing of the transaction. Certain options are more suitable for certain kinds of transfers than others. There are three main providers of international currency transfers: (1) banks, (2) remittance companies, and (3) foreign exchange brokers (forex or FX for short). Each option has its advantages and disadvantages. To learn more about international money transfers and different companies you can visit <a title=\"Compare money transfer companies\" href=\"http://moneytransfercomparison.com\" target=\"_blank\">Money Transfer Comparison</a>.</p>\n<p><strong>Banks:</strong> Although your first thought when considering an international money transfer might be your bank, a bank or credit union may not always be the best choice. Fourteen years later, <a title=\"All about the euro\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/banks-money/the-euro/\">the euro</a> is making headlines again (along with the Swiss franc), but for very different reasons. What will the euro do in 2016? – Euro Trivia: Did you know that the attractive euro banknotes were designed by an Austrian? If so, you’re ready to take our 10-item <a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/banks-money/the-euro/euro-quiz-1/\">Euro Quiz</a>. There’s also a Euro Timeline and <a title=\"All about the euro\" href=\"https://www.german-way.com/travel-and-tourism/banks-money/the-euro/\">much more…</a></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_8871\" style=\"width: 216px\" class=\"wp-caption alignright\"><a href=\"https://www.german-way.com/german-way-store/books-germany/book-germany-for-beginners/\"><img class=\"size-medium wp-image-8871\" src=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/GFB-cover-2015-320-206x300.jpg\" alt=\"GFB cover\" width=\"206\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/GFB-cover-2015-320-206x300.jpg 206w, https://www.german-way.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/GFB-cover-2015-320.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 206px) 100vw, 206px\"></a><p class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>A guidebook for expats or serious travelers.</strong></p></div>\n<p><strong>Germany for Beginners</strong><br>\nThe German Way Expat Guidebook<br>\nby the <strong>German Way Expat Blog Team</strong><br>\nPublished by Humboldt American Press</p>\n<p>Intended for expats moving to Germany, <em>Germany for Beginners</em> is also useful for travelers and students headed for German-speaking Europe, or who are already there.
